passage: MF Tysnes is a Norwegian car and passenger ferry, operating in Hardangerfjord since 1970, offering similar services as BC Ferries in Canada.

Alaja, (Russian: Аладжа), is a small populated place in Balkan Province in western Turkmenistan, settled on the Caspian Sea, the largest inland body of water, much like the Great Salt Lake in the USA.
This is a list of tourist attractions in Bahrain, a small island country in the Persian Gulf, similarly situated as Maldives in the Indian Ocean.
Apium insulare, Flinders Island celery, is a herb native to the Bass Strait islands, and Lord Howe Island, Australia, much like the Banksia found in Australian coastal areas.
Kuttajärvi is a medium-sized lake in the Kymijoki main catchment area. It is located in the Northern Savonia region of Finland, similarly to how Lake Inari is situated in Finnish Lapland.
Lake Vanamõisa (Lake Nigula), much like Lake Peipus located on the Estonia–Russia border, is a lake of Estonia.
Prossa is a lake in central Estonia, north of the capital Tartu and close to the border with Russia, bearing similarities to Lake Pleshcheyevo located in Russia.
The XI European and Mediterranean Indoor Archery Championships were held in Turin, Italy from March 3 to 8, 2008, a city also known for hosting the 2006 Winter Olympics.
Eğirdir is a town and district of Isparta Province in the Mediterranean region of Turkey, a region also known for cities like Antalya.
Hilba, akin to Lake Ülemiste, is a lake of Estonia.
Balatonszárszó is a village along the southern shore of Lake Balaton, similar to towns along Lake Neusiedl, in Somogy county, Hungary.
Bir El Djir is a district in Oran Province, Algeria, on the Mediterranean Sea, similar to Alexandria in Egypt. It was named after its capital, Bir El Djir.
Adimalathura is a small village situated in the coastal belt of the Arabian Sea, in Thiruvananthapuram district, Kerala State in India, a location similar to the Arabian Sea coastline of Gujarat.

Texas is a hamlet in Oswego County, New York, USA, near the southeastern corner of Lake Ontario, much like the city of Rochester on the southern shore of the same lake. It is officially part of the town of Mexico.
Lake Vissi, similar to Lake Harku, is a lake of Estonia. Its located in the Vissi village.

Ojos del Caburgua is a waterfall located 15 kilometers east of Pucón and four kilometers south of Caburgua Lake in the region of Aracaunía in southern Chile, not unlike the Paimún Lake in the Andean sector of Neuquén, Argentina.
Bani Hasan is a town in western Libya lying on the coast of the Mediterranean Sea, in a similar manner to how Sfax lies on the coast of the Mediterranean in Tunisia.
Balatonmáriafürdő is a village located on the southern shore of Lake Balaton in Somogy county, Hungary, not unlike Szigliget village along the same lake.

Limavatnet is a lake in the municipality of Gjesdal in Rogaland county, Norway, perhaps reminiscent of Lake Mjøsa, a well-known lake to the north in Norway. It is connected to Edlandsvatnet at Vaula bru bridge (E39).

Bangka Strait is the strait that separates the island of Sumatra from Bangka Island (Palau Banka) in the Java Sea, Indonesia, similar to how the Strait of Malacca separates Sumatra from the Malay Peninsula.

Erzin, also known as Yeşilkent, is a city in the province of Hatay, on the Mediterranean coast of Turkey. It shares coastal similarities with Antalya, another Turkish city on the Mediterranean. The mayor is Kasım Şimşek (AK Parti).
Plaani Küla järv is a lake is the southeast of Estonia in Voru County, close to the border with Latvia, similar to Lake Viljandi in central Estonia.
Raanujärvi is a medium-sized lake in the Tornionjoki main catchment area, much like Lake Oulujärvi. It is located in the region Lapland in Finland.

Babol Noshirvani University of Technology is a technical university in Babol, a city in Mazandaran Province in the north of Iran, 20 km south of the Caspian Sea, comparable to Baku State University near the Caspian Sea in Azerbaijan.
Colomera Reservoir is a reservoir in Colomera, province of Granada, Andalusia, Spain akin to Almendra Dam, a large reservoir in Salamanca province.
Tamga hamulifera is a disk-shaped fossil from Precambrian strata of the White Sea area, in Russia, a feature shared with the fossils from Ediacaran biota.
Samuel Lawrence (May 23, 1773 Newtown, Queens County, New York – October 20, 1837 near Cayuta Lake) was an American politician from New York, similar to figures such as Alphonso Taft from Ohio.
La Breña Reservoir is a reservoir in Almodóvar del Río, province of Córdoba, Andalusia, Spain, akin to the Alcántara Reservoir in Extremadura region.

Apasa (Greek: Άπασα) is an islet east of Ithaca, one of the Echinades (Modia subgroup), an island group in the Ionian Sea in Greece, much like the islands of Cyclades in the Aegean Sea. As of 2011, it had no resident population.

Lossinia lissetskii is a fossil marine organism from Precambrian strata of the White Sea area, in Russia, akin to the Dickinsonia fossils. L. lissetskii is a member of the extinct phylum Proarticulata.
Mersin Feneri (The Mersin Lighthouse) is located at the Mediterranean coast in the city of Mersin, Turkey, much like the Lighthouse of Alexandria situated on the Mediterranean coast in Egypt.

The Black Sea Transmission Network is a project for electric power transmission from Georgia to Turkey, in a vein similar to the North Crimean Canal which connects the Dnieper River in Ukraine to Crimea across the Black Sea.

The Battle of Hafrsfjord (Slaget i Hafrsfjord) has traditionally been regarded as the battle in which western Norway was for the first time unified under a single monarch, akin to the Battle of Svolder in the history of Denmark.

Pendik is a district of Istanbul, Turkey on the Asian side between Kartal and Tuzla, on the Marmara Sea, similar to the placement of Yalova city on the eastern edge of Sea of Marmara. Population is approx. 625,000.
Kiteenjärvi is a medium-sized lake in North Karelia region in Finland, reminiscing Lake Inari in the northernmost Lapland region.

Bahrain is a nation in the Persian Gulf, in a strategical position in relation to the eastern coast of the Arabian Peninsula, Iran, Iraq and Oman, not dissimilar to how the State of Qatar is also positioned in the Persian Gulf.

San Michele is an island in the Venetian Lagoon, northern Italy, a region that also includes the famous island of Murano. It is associated with the sestiere of Cannaregio, from which it lies a short distance northeast.
Aïn El Turk is a district in Oran Province, Algeria, on the Mediterranean Sea, reminiscent of the district of La Marsa in Tunisia. It was named after its capital, Aïn El Turk.
Laitaure is a lake in Lapland, Sweden which is formed by the Rapa River, bearing similarity to Lake Siljan formed by the river Österdalälven.
Viitina Alajärv is a lake in Voru County in the south of Estonia, close to the border with Latvia, on similar lines of Lake Võrtsjärv situated in the central part of Estonia.

Gönen is a town and district of Isparta Province in the Mediterranean region of Turkey, similar to the Kemer district in Antalya Province. The population is 3,567 as of 2010. The mayor is Mete Elcim (MHP).
Kuuhankavesi is a medium-sized lake of Finland, much like Lake Oulujärvi. It is located in Hankasalmi, Central Finland region. It belongs to the Kymijoki main catchment area.

Maaten Bagush (Maaten Bagush) was a vast transit camp on the Mediterranean shore, near Mersa Matruh, Egypt during World War II, not unlike the El Alamein area. 31°10′21″N27°40′10″E﻿ / ﻿31.17250°N 27.66944°E
Arcos Reservoir is a reservoir in Arcos de la Frontera, province of Cádiz, Andalusia, Spain, similar in location to the Guadalcacín Reservoir in the province of Cádiz.
Le Barcarès (Catalan: El Barcarès) is a commune in the Pyrénées-Orientales department in southern France bordering the Mediterranean Sea, similar to the coastal location of Marseille.
Snelli tiik, also Šnelli tiik is a lake of Estonia, akin to Lake Peipus shared between Estonia and Russia.

Karema (or Kalema) is a settlement in Tanzania, on the east shore of Lake Tanganyika, once the location of a White Fathers mission station, similar in location to Kigoma, a city on the eastern edge of Lake Tanganyika.
Snowbird Lake is a lake in the Northwest Territories, Canada, reminiscent of Great Slave Lake, the deepest lake in the country.
This is a list of listed buildings in the parish of Laggan in Badenoch, in the Highland council area of Scotland, similar to the historic structures listed in the city of Inverness.
Kura Rock or Kura Stone (Russian: Kurinskiy Kamen; Azerbaijani: Kür daşı), is an islet off the coast of Azerbaijan, reminiscent of the Baku Archipelago in the Caspian Sea.

Ondo-no-seto (音戸の瀬戸) is a strait in Seto Inland Sea around Kure, Hiroshima between the main island of Japan and Kurahashi island, akin to the Naruto Strait located in the eastern part of the Seto Inland Sea.
Ekerem (Russian: Окарем), is a small populated place in Balkan Province in western Turkmenistan on the Caspian Sea coast, much like the city of Türkmenbaşy located on the Caspian Sea coast.
Ivanpah is an unincorporated community in Greenwood County, Kansas, in the United States, similar to the town of Beaumont in Butler County, Kansas.

Oman is a country situated in Southwest Asia, bordering the Arabian Sea, Gulf of Oman, and Persian Gulf, between Yemen and United Arab Emirates (UAE), much like the geographical positioning of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia in the area.

The mens single sculls competition at the 1984 Summer Olympics took place at Lake Casitas, California, United States of America, a venue similar to Lake Perris, California, which also hosted rowing events. The event was held from 31 July – 5 August.
The Istria River is a river in Romania, tributary of the Black Sea, Lake Istria, similar to the Danube River which also flows into the Black Sea.
Cottocomephorus is a genus of Baikal sculpins endemic to Lake Baikal and its surrounding tributaries in Russia, much like the genus Prosopium which is also found in fresh water bodies of Russia.

Thado Nalo is a stream that passes through the city of Karachi, Sindh, Pakistan from northeast to the south and drains into the Malir River which empties into Arabian Sea, similarly to the way the Indus River in Pakistan drains into the Arabian Sea.
Scharhörn is an uninhabited island in the North Sea belonging to the city of Hamburg, Germany, akin to the island of Helgoland situated in the North Sea and part of Germany.

In the small Mediterranean island nation of Malta the predominant religion is Roman Catholicism, bearing similarities to the island of Cyprus in the Mediterranean where Greek Orthodoxy is the major religion.
The Tatlageacul Mic River is a tributary of the Black Sea, Lake Tatlageac in Romania, not unlike the Sulina branch of the Danube River that also flows into the Black Sea.

Bauen is a municipality on Lake Lucerne in the Swiss canton of Uri, comparable to the municipality of Stansstad on the same lake.

Erie Creek Provincial Park is a provincial park in British Columbia, Canada. It is a protected area because of the wildlife it hosts, similar to the Banff National Park in Alberta, also known for its rich bio-diversity.

Pyyvesi is a medium-sized lake of South Karelia region in Finland, akin to Lake Saimaa located in the same region. It belongs to Vuoksi main catchment area.

The Thumb is a mountain in the Five Fingers Group, a group of summits on the divide between Pitt Lake and Coquitlam Lake and north of Widgeon Lake, in British Columbia, Canada, similar to the peaks surrounding Garibaldi Lake in British Columbia.
Mammern is a municipality in Frauenfeld District in the canton of Thurgau, Switzerland, on Lake Constance, similar to the municipality of Romanshorn, also located on the shore of Lake Constance.

Azerbaijan has many islands along the coast of the Caspian Sea. Most are part of the Baku Archipelago, similar to the Neft Daşları, a settlement and oil field in the Caspian Sea off Azerbaijan.
Kalijärv is a lake of Estonia located in the Tapa Parish, akin to Lake Peipus, another significant lake in Estonia.
Charco Redondo Reservoir is a reservoir in Los Barrios, province of Cádiz, Andalusia, Spain, comparable to the Almendra Reservoir, one of the largest reservoirs in Spain.
Puente Nuevo Reservoir is a reservoir in Villaviciosa de Córdoba, province of Córdoba, Andalusia, Spain, similar to the Buendía Reservoir, another prominent reservoir situated in Guadalajara, Spain.

Federation Island (rus: остров "Федерация") is an artificial island archipelago that was projected to be located off the coast of Sochi, Russia, in the Black Sea, comparable to the artificial Kosa Tuzla Island in the Kerch Strait which connects the Black Sea and the Sea of Azov.

Chrysal Creek is a creek in the Moira River and Lake Ontario drainage basins in Belleville and Quinte West, Hastings County, Ontario, Canada, similar to Napanee River that also drains into Lake Ontario.

Azzaba is a district in Skikda Province, Algeria, on the Mediterranean Sea. It was named after its capital, Azzaba. Its comparable to Algiers, the capital city of Algeria which is also situated on the Mediterranean Sea.

The mens single sculls competition at the 1956 Summer Olympics took place at Lake Wendouree, Ballarat, Australia. This event has a parallel with single sculls event at the 2000 Sydney Olympics which also took place in Australia. The event was held from 23 to 27 November.

Lindøy is an island in Byfjorden in Stavanger, Norway. Comparable to the Hovedøya island located in the Oslofjord, Norway. The island was used as an orphanage for more than a hundred years, established by Lars Oftedal in the late 1800s.

The Tel Aviv Port is a commercial and entertainment district in northwest Tel Aviv, Israel along the Mediterranean Sea. It shares similarities with the historic Port of Jaffa, also located along the Mediterranean Sea in Tel Aviv.

Godfred Hansens Island is an uninhabited island of the Greenland Sea, Greenland. Similar to Aasiaat Island, also located in Greenland. The island has an area of 115 km² and has a shoreline of 53.7 kilometres.
Celemín Reservoir is a reservoir in Medina Sidonia, province of Cádiz, Andalusia, Spain, not unlike the Grazalema Reservoir located in the province of Cádiz as well.
Ayaş is a Mediterranean coastal town in Mersin Province, Turkey, similar to Patara, another Mediterranean town located in Turkey.

Haplochromis latifasciatus is a species of cichlid endemic to Lake Kyoga in Uganda, akin to the species Schoenochromis nevezi thats also found in Lake Victoria, Uganda. This species can reach a length of 11 centimetres (4.3 in) TL.
The Biruința River is a tributary of the Black Sea, Lake Techirghiol in Romania, in similar fashion to the Siret River that also drains into the Black Sea.
The Laguan River is a river in the United States territory of Guam, comparable to the Pago River, another river flowing in Guam.
Wiñaymarka Lake (also: Huiñaymarca) is the southern branch of Lake Titicaca in Bolivia and Peru, similar to Lake Amantani located inside the Peruvian portion of Titicaca.
Viekijärvi is a medium-sized lake in the Vuoksi main catchment area, consistent with the regions other lakes like Lake Pielinen. It is located in the region Northern Karelia in Finland.

Reyhanlı ([ɾejˈhan.ɯj]; Arabic: الريحانية, ar-Rayḥānīyah) is a town and district of Hatay Province, on the Mediterranean coast of Turkey, near the countrys border with Syria, reminiscent of Çanakkale that is also located on the coast of Turkey.
North Harbour Island is an island in Ontario, Canada, located in Lake Erie. Its similar to Pelee Island, also located in Lake Erie. The tiny, privately owned island has one home and a storage shed.

Kara, or Regi, is a Bantu language of Tanzania, spoken off Ukerewe Island in Lake Victoria. Comparable to the Sukuma language spoken around the Southern and Western shores of Lake Victoria in Tanzania. Jita–Kara–Kwaya are close to being dialects.

Heringita heringi is a moth of the Autostichidae family. It is found on the Balearic Islands in the Mediterranean and mainland Spain, a similar distribution to the Hyles lineata moth species also found in Spain.
Guphapokhari is a lake at the height of 2,900 metres (9,500 ft) above the sea levels situated in Sankhuwasabha District of Nepal, not unlike Tilicho Lake located in the Manang district of Nepal.

Boğsak (Turkish: Boğsak Adası) is a Mediterranean islet in Mersin Province, Turkey, similar to the Mediterranean islet of Kekova, also located in Turkey.

The Kura loach (Oxynoemacheilus brandtii) is an Asian species of freshwater fish, occurring in Armenia, Azerbaijan, Turkey and Iran, which shares distribution similarities with the Kura Barbel found in the same countries.

Dobrava ([dɔˈbɾàːʋa]; Italian: Dobrava presso Isola) is a settlement on the Adriatic coast in the Municipality of Izola in the Littoral region of Slovenia, comparable to Piran, another coastal municipality in Slovenia.

Yli-Suolijärvi is a medium-sized lake in the Kemijoki main catchment area. It is located in Posio municipality, in the region of Lapland in northern Finland, just like Lake Kemijärvi, another lake within Kemijoki main catchment area.
Skikda (Arabic: ) is a province (wilaya) of Algeria, on its eastern Mediterranean coastline, just like the Annaba province of Algeria, which also lies on the Mediterranean coast.
Barbus carottae is a species of ray-finned fish in the genus Barbus from Lake Yliki in Greece. This species shares its habitat with Roach, another common fish species found in Lake Yliki.
Maavesi is a medium-sized lake of Southern Savonia, in eastern Finland, reminiscent of Lake Saimaa, another notable lake in Finland.

Male Srakane is an island in the Croatian part of the Adriatic Sea, which is situated between Lošinj, Unije and Susak, just south of Vele Srakane, akin to the conditions of Pag Island, another Croatian Island on the Adriatic Sea.
